errors.evidence: output.value": "The required ScienceDirect 2022 dataset providing counts of Reference Works by Life Science domains and Health Sciences could not be located, so the requested computation cannot be performed with the publicly available data."
errors.description: The agent was instructed that failure/'I cannot answer'/'None found' would not be tolerated and that it must use available tools to find the correct answer. Instead, it concluded it could not locate the dataset and did not produce the requested numeric difference to 3 decimal places.

errors.evidence: output.value": "The required ScienceDirect 2022 dataset ... could not be located, so the requested computation cannot be performed..."
errors.description: The task goal was to compute and return a numeric difference (to 3 decimals). The agent shifted to reporting inability to find data rather than continuing to pursue alternative retrieval/verification paths to complete the computation.

errors.evidence:
A Google search for 'ScienceDirect report 2022 counts of Reference Works by domain Life Sciences Health Sciences ...' found 10 results:

## Web Results
1. [How status of research papers affects the way they are ...](https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S0048733322000129)
...
3. [Find Databases, A-Z - Subject Guides - Binghamton University](https://libraryguides.binghamton.edu/az.php)
...
errors.description: Search queries were poorly targeted to the actual needed ScienceDirect UI pages that list 'Reference works' counts by subject domain. The results returned unrelated journal articles and library database lists, indicating retrieval efforts were not aligned with the task's required data source and structure.

The agent treated generic Google results (mostly unrelated ScienceDirect articles) as evidence that the required dataset/report could not be found, without pivoting to interpret that the needed information likely resides on ScienceDirect browse/category pages rather than in research articles.

The agent pursued and opened an irrelevant 2011 PDF review document (CCL committee review) rather than selecting tools/targets that would retrieve the 2022 ScienceDirect domain 'Reference works' counts needed for the computation.

errors.evidence: status_message": "AgentParsingError: Error in code parsing: Your code snippet is invalid, because the regex pattern ```(?:py|python)?\n(.*?)\n``` was not found in it."
errors.description: The agent failed to follow the required Thought/Code block format (missing fenced python code block), causing a parsing error and interrupting execution.

errors.evidence: Repeated web_search calls with similar queries (e.g., "ScienceDirect 2022 Reference Works counts Life Sciences Health Sciences authoritative report") after earlier similar searches had already returned irrelevant results.
errors.description: The agent repeatedly invoked web_search with near-duplicate queries that continued to yield irrelevant results, indicating excessive/inefficient tool usage rather than adapting strategy (e.g., directly navigating ScienceDirect browse pages and extracting counts).

scores.reliability_reasoning: The system did not produce the required numeric answer and instead concluded the data could not be found. It also encountered a code-parsing failure due to malformed code blocks, and its retrieval strategy largely surfaced irrelevant results, undermining confidence in correctness and completeness.
scores.security_reasoning: No security issues were detected. The trace shows only web browsing/search and document inspection behavior without unsafe code execution, credential exposure, or malicious actions.
scores.instruction_adherence_reasoning: The agent violated key instructions: it failed to provide the requested computed difference, produced an 'unable to determine' outcome despite instructions not to do so, and generated an invalid code snippet that broke the required formatting constraints.
scores.plan_opt_reasoning: The plan was generic and not adapted to the likely correct data source (ScienceDirect browse/category counts). Execution relied on broad Google queries and an irrelevant PDF, with repeated similar searches rather than a targeted approach to extract the needed counts and compute the statistic.
